Figure¬†1: Sine function




Lie Group
Mechanical systems on Lie groups are often modeled as left-invariant control systems (Bullo and Lewis 1995).
More advanced treatment can be found in (Lee 2017).
\[
\left.\frac{\partial H(x,y,y',p)}{\partial y'}\right|_{p = \frac{\partial L(x,y,y')}{\partial y'}} = 0.
\tag{1}\]
Eq.¬†1 is given by the equation of stationarity






Figure¬†2: Rotation diagram



As seen in Fig.¬†2 ‚Ä¶

Visit the Quarto website for documentation.

Bullo, Francesco, and Andrew D. Lewis. 1995. ‚ÄúGeometric Control of Mechanical Systems.‚Äù IEEE Transactions on Automatic Control 40 (6): 1042‚Äì48.


Lee, Taeyoung. 2017. Global Formulations of Classical Mechanics. Princeton University Press.

title: Kinematics & Dynamics
text: Knowing how to model equations of motions for robots, and simulate and control or even estimate them with those equations using numericla methods.
